result.execSummary:
The defendant Rickey L Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rickey L Walker is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rickey L Walker was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED.   Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
AODA and treatment as recommended and sobriety.
AODA and treatment as recommended and sobriety.
Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JR.

Completion of certified domestic violence treatment. Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rickey L Walker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.

Reporter: Melanie Olsen; re: Atty Taylor's motion to withdraw plea and motion to withdraw as counsel; Ct questions defn; defn responds; ADA objects to motion to withdraw plea; Ct explains to defn; defn understand; Ct denies motion to withdraw plea; Ct permits Atty Taylor to withdraw as counsel; Ct modifies bond-added BMP; Ct sets over SEH; Ct adjourned.

- The court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendants appearance in court.  Cash bond is set in the amount of $500.00.  If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release  The defendant shall report to DCBM immediately.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM a body only bench warrant, or if the defendant is already in custody, an order, shall be issued for defendant's arrest and defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by court.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jody R.
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur.  The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 12
